intro: Lessingia tenuis, commonly known as the slender lessingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. Lessingia tenuis is an herbaceous perennial that is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
